about_us.caption: Get to know me before you dive into my content.
about_us.description: I am a self-employed software and web engineer dedicated to learning and teaching JavaScript for client-server architectures. After obtaining my Master's Degree in computer science, I gained experience from the startup world, where I used JavaScript intensively during both my professional life and spare time. Eventually it led me to teach others about these topics and to offer online courses and on-site consulting for companies. I am happy to welcome you on my website :-)

what_i_offer.caption: Why you might want to hire me.

items.title: Workshops
items.description: Teaching your team on-site/remote to get them up to speed with the latest web technologies for client-server applications in JavaScript.

items.title: Code Audit
items.description: Conducting code reviews for your JavaScript application together with your team or a single person which usually last 2-3 days.

items.title: MVP
items.description: Bringing your idea to code from zero to one as a minimal viable product (MVP) and beyond within a well-architected application.

items.title: Complex Problems
items.description: Solving complex problems in JavaScript code which you want to have eliminated in your application's code base but no one dares to fix.

items.title: Writing Code
items.description: Coding along with your team on a large scale application to make your customers happy with new features and performance improvements.

items.title: Technical Writing
items.description: Writing tutorials about your technical product, open source work, or API (all related to JavaScript) to get more publicity for it.

Portfolio.caption: What you can learn from me.

items.title: Master of Science
items.description: I graduated with a master of science in computer science. Lots of this knowledge can be applied for more complex problems in client-server architectures.

items.title: Freelancer
items.description: While studing computer science, I got my hands dirty by writing JavaScript, Java, and C# applications for several clients in Germany.

items.title: Startups
items.description: I worked closely with an exceptional team of engineers at a company in Berlin developing large scale applications for thousands of customers.

items.title: React Book
items.description: This year I published my first book about React.js. Within the first month it had more than 10.000 readers and today it is one of the most popular React.js books.

items.title: Redux Book
items.description: I published my second book about state management with Redux in React.js which I took one level further by packaging it as a full-blown online course.

items.title: GraphQL Book
items.description: As an early adopter of GraphQL in my recent jobs, I wrote my third book about it for modern client-server applications using GraphQL in JavaScript.

items.title: Developer Magazines
items.description: Every other month I write for a German software developer magazine educational content about JavaScript and its ecosystem.

items.title: Firebase Book
items.description: Later this year, I published my fourth book/course about Firebase in React to build modern frontend applications without worrying about your backend application.

items.title: Self-Employed
items.description: Lots of demand for JavaScript on-site or remote training, implementations for MVPs, code reviews, or complex JavaScript problem solving, led me to being self-employed.
